Input/Output Privacy Policy

Input/Output is provided as a public service and is not a commercial product.

The app does not collect any personal information from the authentication providers it uses to authenticate you when you login. We are provided with a unique identifier (which looks something like BzWK4x9dqFgL2r5hbDfTkKnARGm2) and we use that as a key into our database to store your information. No other personal information is collected, not your name, not your email address, not your computer's IP address. Nothing.

The app is built using Google's Firebase platform, which means that we rely on Google not to surreptitiously collect data behind the scenes. However, they attest that the Firebase platform is compliant with GDPR and introduces no additional reporting requirements other than those needed by the apps built on its platform. So this is a good indication that they are not storing any data that we are not explicitly asking them to store, and we are not explicitly asking them to store anything that is not completely essential to the operation of the app: your unique identifier and the data you add to the app itself.

The app currently does not use any analytics platform to compute aggregated information about its usage. I have no plans to activate analytics for the app, but if I do so, it will be noted in this privacy policy. As this is not a commercial product, there is no particular need to know even aggregate information about its users.

The app does use cookies for the sole purpose of avoiding the need to log in every single time you access the app. A unique "session" identifier is generated and stored on your web browser to facilitate this process. The session identifier can be linked to your account identifier (as described above) and that's it. The session identifier is necessarily secret and is not stored anywhere except your computer and (temporarily) on the servers. Neither it nor your account identifier are shared with anyone.

None of the data you add to the app is shared with any third party. It is only ever stored on devices you use to access the app and on the cloud servers that host the app. It is not used for advertising or "mined" for other information in any way.

The app relies on the security of the Firebase platform, and the authentication provider you choose, to secure your data. Firebase uses modern best practices for authentication security and backend server security, so we have no reason to believe that the data you store in the Input/Output app is any less secure than all the other major websites you probably use.

If you have questions regarding this privacy policy, please contact me.
